reg32.name: FORCE_EARLY_FRAGMENT_TESTS
reg32.doc: If false, early tests are enabled only when possible, i.e. no alpha test, no discard, no g[] access, no depth export, ...

reg32.name: UNK0220
reg32.doc: Very likely to be manual vertex data submission.

reg32.name: GLOBAL_BASE
reg32.doc: Remaps high byte of g[] address used in CP (INDEX -> HIGH).

reg32.name: BUFFER_OFFSET
reg32.doc: In bytes. Use with TFB query 0xd to resume transform feedback.

reg32.name: UNK0740
reg32.doc: 0-3, rasterized stream ? Seems to just disable all drawing (including CLEAR_BUFFERS).

bitfield.name: MIN_SAMPLES
bitfield.doc: 1, 2, 4, or 8. Takes effect even if ENABLE is 0.

reg32.name: UNK07E4
reg32.doc: 0-0xffff, only seen as 0x07e0 shifted right by 16

reg32.name: ZCULL_LIMIT_LOW
reg32.doc: ADDRESS + align((width * height) / 28, 128 KiB), receives the same address as the next allocated object, so should be a limit ... doesn't have any immediate effect though (as long as data is in cache ?)

reg32.name: CALL_LIMIT_LOG
reg32.doc: Determines how many "limitted" calls are allowed. Value 0 means none. Values 1-8 are interpretted as log2(limit)+1. Value 0xf means unlimitted.

reg32.name: RT_SEPARATE_FRAG_DATA
reg32.doc: If disabled, all RTs receive colour output 0, regardless of RT_CONTROL or the bit in the FP header. XXX: what else ?

reg32.name: CLEAR_FLAGS
reg32.doc: Selects which states affect CLEAR_BUFFERS. CLIP_RECT, CLIPID and SCREEN_SCISSOR always affect it.

reg32.name: VERTEX_ID_BASE
reg32.doc: Seems broken: when used in VERTEX_DATA mode, the value is always that for the last vertex of a primitive.

reg32.name: UNK1430
reg32.doc: Goes to ROP. Both set when NOT MS/CS.

bitfield.name: IDX
bitfield.doc: The layer to render into, when not selected by GP.

bitfield.name: INSTANCE_NEXT
bitfield.doc: If set, increment INSTANCE_ID (before processing new vertices).

bitfield.name: INSTANCE_CONT
bitfield.doc: If set, keep current INSTANCE_ID, otherwise reset it to 0. If set together with INSTANCE_NEXT, an INVALID_ENUM error is generated.

reg32.name: VERTEX_ID_REPLACE
reg32.doc: Take value from VP input a[SOURCE * 4] and stuff it into a[0x2fc].

bitfield.name: ALWAYS_DERIV
bitfield.doc: Always use auto LOD selection by implicit derivatives, even in program types other than FP.

reg32.name: VERTEX_QUARANTINE_SIZE
reg32.doc: Stuff written to VERTEX_DATA gets put here. Maye more at higher offsets ? It looks like this should be 1 MiB in size.

reg32.name: VIEW_VOLUME_CLIP_CTRL
reg32.doc: 2c1c: grctx default 0000: cull whole triangles only 0002: make depth clamp work even if only 0080 is set and 1000 is not 0008: clamp -z 0010: clamp +z 0080: cull whole points and lines too, make depth clamp not work 1000: clip properly if 0080 is set, make depth clamp work again

reg32.name: CLIP_DISTANCE_MODE
reg32.doc: A Primitive is culled if any cull distance is less than 0 for all its vertices. In CULL mode, triangles are unmodified if they intersect a plane. In CLIP mode, the expected "cutting" occurs.

reg32.name: ZCULL_TEST_MASK
reg32.doc: Set FAIL_GT_PASS_LT to 1 if the FP may increase the depth result, and PASS_GT_FAIL_LT to 1 if the FP may decrease the depth result. The prior disables coarse rejection/pass for GT/LT direction, the latter disables coarse rejection/pass for LT/GT direction. Looks useful for ARB_conservative_depth.

reg32.name: CLIPID_FILL
reg32.doc: Writes param to CLIPID subrectangle specified by intersection of SCREEN_SCISSOR and CLIPID_FILL_RECT.
